title: Photoelectric effect - which devices eject e

content.question: Devices <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math> emit light of wavelengths <math alttext="310 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>310</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math>, <math alttext="620 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>620</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="1240 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1240</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math>, respectively. Light from each device is incident on a metal that has work function <math alttext="3 electron volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>eV</mtext></math>. Which of the following, if any, indicates the device or devices from which emitted light results in the ejection of electrons from the metal?

choices.label: Devices <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> and <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> only

Devices <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>
There is no device from which emitted light results in the ejection of electrons.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
